intro: Acer platanoides var. palmatifidum, commonly known as the Japanese maple, is a deciduous tree native to Japan. It is characterized by its delicate, palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant red or orange in the fall. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a rounded, upright form. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, appearing in clusters before the leaves emerge in spring. The bark is smooth and reddish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
